class_notes:
"Thinking Through Materials"The organic warmth of wood, the uncanny plasticity of wax, the brute density of concrete, the immateriality of light. This innovative seminar, co-taught by an art historian and a practicing artist, will alternate between hands-on experimentation with materials (both traditional and unconventional) and theoretical-historical consideration of significant art historical uses of such materials in the 20th century. We will grapple with the economic, political, and cultural contexts that give meaning to artists' choice of materials and means of production. At the same time, we will ponder how materials might be thought to have agency in the artistic process.
Art History major/minor: Division III
Art History Visual Art Concentration: elective
course_description: Advanced seminars dealing with various specialized problems in the history of art from antiquity to modern times, such as individual artists, genres (e.g. portraiture, landscape); themes (e.g. theory, iconography); artistic movements and museum studies. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
